alert.note: Alert for Geneva (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 04 at 6:33PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN GENEVA AND HOUSTON COUNTIES... At 633 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Columbia to near Graceville, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Cottonwood, Dothan, Taylor, Ashford, Cowarts, Webb, Columbia, Kinsey, Malvern, Rehobeth, Avon, Madrid, Gordon, Memphis, Pansey, Crosby, Grangeburg, Garretts Crossroads, Sigma and Enon. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Tallahassee.
